parts: Create a high-level system architecture diagram for the Contractor Lens application. The diagram should clearly show the relationship and data flow between the following major components: iOS Mobile App, Web Application, Backend API (Cloud Run), and the Firebase database. Indicate the use of third-party services such as Stripe, Gemini, and Vertex AI. Use boxes for components and arrows for data flows. Label all parts of the diagram with descriptive names, and make the connections between components obvious.

content.text:
{"validDiagramCode": "flowchart TD
  A[iOS Mobile App] --> C[Backend API (Cloud Run)]
  B[Web Application] --> C
  C --> D[Firebase Database]
  C --> E[Stripe]
  C --> F[Gemini]
  C --> G[Vertex AI]
  subgraph User Interface
    A
    B
  end
  subgraph Backend Services
    C
    D
    E
    F
    G
  end"}

parts:
Here is the high-level system architecture diagram for the Contractor Lens application:

![View Diagram](https://mlai.lucid.app/plugin/images/aiplugin_dfa6fa61-968b-4512-9772-17864381587f)

### Key Features:
1. **Components**:
   - **iOS Mobile App** and **Web Application**: These are user-facing interfaces.
   - **Backend API (Cloud Run)**: Central processing hub for communication between components.
   - **Firebase Database**: Primary data storage.
   - **Stripe**: Handles payment processing.
   - **Gemini**: Third-party integration (e.g., analytics or project management tools).
   - **Vertex AI**: AI and ML services.

2. **Data Flows**:
   - User interfaces (iOS and Web) communicate with the Backend API.
   - The Backend API interacts with the Firebase Database and third-party services (Stripe, Gemini, Vertex AI).

### Links:
- **Thumbnail View**: Click the image above to preview.
- **Edit Diagram**: [Edit this diagram in Lucidchart](https://mlai.lucid.app/plugin/edit/aiplugin_dfa6fa61-968b-4512-9772-17864381587f)

Let me know if you'd like adjustments or additional details!

parts: Create a detailed deployment diagram for the Contractor Lens backend on Google Cloud Platform. The diagram should clearly show how the following GCP services are utilized: Cloud Run (for the backend API), Firestore (for data storage), Vertex AI (for AI processing), Gemini API (for real time visual processing), BigQuery (for data analysis), Cloud Storage (for large data objects), and Google Secret Manager (for storing secure credentials). Show load balancing and all data flows, and ensure all components are labeled clearly.

content.text:
{"validDiagramCode": "flowchart TD
  subgraph Deployment Diagram
    A[User Requests]
    A --> B[Load Balancer]
    B --> C[Cloud Run (Backend API)]
    C --> D[Firestore (Data Storage)]
    C --> E[Vertex AI (AI Processing)]
    C --> F[Gemini API (Real-Time Visual Processing)]
    C --> G[BigQuery (Data Analysis)]
    C --> H[Cloud Storage (Large Data Objects)]
    C --> I[Google Secret Manager (Secure Credentials)]
  end
  subgraph GCP Services
    C
    D
    E
    F
    G
    H
    I
  end"}

parts:
Here’s the detailed deployment diagram for the Contractor Lens backend on Google Cloud Platform:

![View Diagram](https://mlai.lucid.app/plugin/images/aiplugin_24080283-f411-4cdf-a2f1-7555cddc2c3b)

### Components:
1. **User Requests**:
   - Incoming requests pass through a **Load Balancer** to distribute traffic efficiently.
2. **Cloud Run (Backend API)**:
   - The core service for handling business logic and coordinating interactions with other GCP services.
3. **Firestore (Data Storage)**:
   - Used for structured and unstructured data storage.
4. **Vertex AI (AI Processing)**:
   - Handles AI and ML workloads, such as predictions or data analysis.
5. **Gemini API (Real-Time Visual Processing)**:
   - Integrates for handling visual processing tasks like image analysis or enhancements.
6. **BigQuery (Data Analysis)**:
   - For querying and analyzing large datasets.
7. **Cloud Storage (Large Data Objects)**:
   - Stores larger files such as user uploads, media, or datasets.
8. **Google Secret Manager**:
   - Safeguards sensitive information like API keys or database credentials.

### Data Flows:
- User requests are routed via the Load Balancer to Cloud Run.
- The Backend API communicates with:
  - Firestore for data retrieval/storage.
  - Vertex AI for advanced AI processing.
  - Gemini API for real-time visual tasks.
  - BigQuery for data analysis and reporting.
  - Cloud Storage for managing large objects.
  - Google Secret Manager to access secure credentials.

### Links:
- **Thumbnail View**: Click the image above to preview.
- **Edit Diagram**: [Edit this diagram in Lucidchart](https://mlai.lucid.app/plugin/edit/aiplugin_24080283-f411-4cdf-a2f1-7555cddc2c3b)

Let me know if you need any refinements or extra details!

parts:
Create a detailed mind map for a multi-platform application called "Contractor Lens" designed for construction contractors. The central idea of the mind map should be "Contractor Lens".

Branch 1: Core Features
This branch should detail the main features of the application.

    Sub-branch 1: AR Scanning
    Keywords: iOS, ARKit, RoomPlan, LiDAR, real-time video, object detection, automatic measurements, spatial data, 3D mesh, on-device processing, minimal user input, scanning accuracy, error handling, user guidance, scan modes, data quality, automated processing, custom object scanning, manual measurements, external LiDAR scanner support.

    Sub-branch 2: AI-Powered Estimation
    Keywords: Gemini 2.0, dynamic prompts, Vertex AI, estimate generation, cost breakdowns, labor estimates, material costs, assumptions, automated, user review, editing, feedback loop, multi-modal prompts, real-time adjustments.

    Sub-branch 3: Client Portal
    Keywords: secure link, estimate review, accept, decline, digital signature, payment processing, client communication, project status, partial acceptance.

    Sub-branch 4: Payments and Invoicing
    Keywords: Stripe integration, invoice generation, payment tracking, automated reminders, payment plans, secure payments.

    Sub-branch 5: Automated Communication
    Keywords: email, SMS, notifications, reminders, follow-ups, customizable templates, SendGrid, Twilio, automated messaging, client interaction history.

    Sub-branch 6: CRM & Project Management
    Keywords: client management, estimate management, project tracking, task lists, calendar integration, expense tracking, QuickBooks integration, lead management, pipeline stages, user roles, permissions, team collaboration.

    Sub-branch 7: Subscription Management
     Keywords: tiered subscriptions, Basic, Pro, Enterprise, seat-based access, user limits, feature access, free trial, StoreKit (iOS), Stripe (Web), user self-service, upgrade, downgrade, cancellation, billing management.

Branch 2: Technology Stack
This branch should detail the technologies used to build the application.

    Sub-branch 1: iOS Mobile App
    Keywords: Swift, SwiftUI, ARKit, RoomPlan, StoreKit, Firebase SDK, TensorFlow Lite, ML Kit, Lidar.

    Sub-branch 2: Web Application
    Keywords: React, Next.js, Firebase SDK, bolt.new, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, ESLint, Prettier, Jest, App Router.

    Sub-branch 3: Backend API
    Keywords: Python, Flask, FastAPI, Cloud Run, Firebase Admin SDK, Stripe SDK, Vertex AI SDK, Gemini API, Google Cloud SDK, REST API, OpenAPI, data validation, authentication, authorization, webhooks, task queues.

    Sub-branch 4: Data Storage
    Keywords: Firestore, BigQuery, Google Cloud Storage, data models, data security, backups, data retention, indexing, querying.

    Sub-branch 5: AI/ML
    Keywords: Gemini 2.0, Vertex AI, AutoML, Recommendation Systems, TensorFlow Lite, ML Kit, custom models, on-device processing, cloud processing, API integrations, model training, fine-tuning, model selection.

    Sub-branch 6: Cloud Infrastructure
    Keywords: Google Cloud Platform, Firebase, Cloud Run, Firestore, BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Google Secret Manager, load balancing, scaling, monitoring, logging, security, deployment, Cloud Functions.

    Sub-branch 7: Third-Party Integrations
    Keywords: Stripe, SendGrid, Twilio, QuickBooks, Zapier, DocuSign, Adobe Sign, Google Calendar, analytics platforms, digital signature platforms.

Branch 3: Revenue Model
This branch should detail the pricing and subscription strategy.

    Sub-branch 1: Pricing Tiers
    Keywords: Freemium, Basic ($75/month, 1 user, 100 estimates), Pro ($200/month, 3 users, 300 estimates), Enterprise ($350/month, 5 users, 500 estimates), features, seat-based pricing, usage limits, priority support, free trial.

    Sub-branch 2: Cost Structure
    Keywords: AR scanning, AI processing, data storage, on-device processing, cloud services, API usage, Gemini API, Vertex AI, infrastructure, development, support, marketing.

    Sub-branch 3: Financial Projections
    Keywords: Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR), Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR), user growth, subscription tiers, cost per estimate, profitability, customer acquisition cost (CAC), customer lifetime value (CLTV), churn rate, conversion rate, operating expenses.

Branch 4: AI Enhancements
This branch should detail the different AI enhancements that are planned for the application.

    Sub-branch 1: Internal (Platform Operations)
    Keywords: customer churn prediction, subscription tier analysis, trend analysis, anomaly detection, fraud detection, performance optimization, A/B testing, support, troubleshooting, automation, reporting, monitoring, usage patterns, user behavior, error rates, API calls.

    Sub-branch 2: External (User & Client Facing)
    Keywords: ultra-precise measurement, dynamic occlusion handling, material detection, real-time processing, multi-modal prompts, dynamic prompt adjustment, adaptive estimating, automated assumptions, error correction, personalized recommendations, dynamic proposal generation, automated contract review, intelligent follow-ups, payment plans, fraud detection, automated payment reminders, contextual communication, multi-channel communication, dynamic milestone adjustment, proactive support, chatbot, user feedback, continuous learning.

Branch 5: Market and Competition
This branch should describe the overall market and the competition.

    Sub-branch 1: Market Pain Points
    Keywords: manual measurements, time-consuming, inaccurate estimates, slow turnaround, inconsistent pricing, inefficient workflows, lost opportunities, client frustration, project management, administrative overhead.

    Sub-branch 2: Target Audience
    Keywords: residential contractors, remodelers, painters, carpenters, flooring specialists, small to medium-sized businesses, tech-savvy contractors, construction industry.

    Sub-branch 3: Competitive Landscape
    Keywords: existing solutions, limitations, manual processes, outdated technology, inefficient tools, lack of AR/AI, opportunity for disruption, differentiation, superior value proposition, market share.

Branch 6: Development Process
This branch should describe the key aspects of the development process.

   Sub-branch 1: Methodology
    Keywords: Agile, iterative development, continuous improvement, user feedback, data-driven decisions, version control, testing, modularity, scalability, maintainability, code reviews, documentation.

   Sub-branch 2: Tools
    Keywords: VS Code, Xcode, Android Studio, GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, Jira, Trello, Slack, Google Cloud Console, Firebase Console, bolt.new, OpenAPI.

   Sub-branch 3: Team
    Keywords: developers, designers, product managers, QA testers, technical leads, project managers, communication, collaboration, roles, responsibilities, expertise.

   Sub-branch 4: Security
    Keywords: authentication, authorization, data encryption, API keys, Google Secret Manager, OAuth, JWT, Firebase Authentication, secure coding practices, vulnerability testing, security audits.

  Sub-branch 5: Deployment
   Keywords: CI/CD, GitHub Actions, Cloud Run, Firebase Hosting, App Store, TestFlight, Google Play Store, automated testing, deployment pipeline, versioning, rollback strategy.

  Sub-branch 6: Monitoring and Logging
   Keywords: Google Cloud Logging, Firebase Crashlytics, error tracking, performance monitoring, usage analytics, alerts, dashboards, reporting, debugging, troubleshooting.

Branch 7: Future Considerations
This branch should detail any future plans or considerations for the application.

   Sub-branch 1: Scalability
    Keywords: infrastructure, database, API, cloud services, load balancing, auto-scaling, performance optimization, caching, modular architecture, microservices.

   Sub-branch 2: Extensibility
    Keywords: new features, integrations, third-party services, API updates, AI model updates, platform expansion, Android app, user feedback, market trends, emerging technologies.

   Sub-branch 3: Internationalization
    Keywords: localization, language support, currency, units of measurement, date/time formats, regulatory compliance, cultural adaptation, global expansion.

   Sub-branch 4: Accessibility
    Keywords: inclusive design, assistive technologies, screen readers, keyboard navigation, visual impairments, hearing impairments, motor impairments, cognitive impairments, accessibility standards, WCAG guidelines.
